paragraphs.text: Great article. Thanks for the share. My wife had Er/Pr+ HER2- Breast Cancer with Metastatic evidence in the lymph and elsewhere in the same breast. We engaged in food protocol religiously. We studied voraciously. Tumor regressed 35% monthly on MRI. She is 1 year clear, no cancer. I lost 110 lbs. Not one drug. Food matters. Gene Expression. Favorable…

paragraphs.text: Wow, Ellen. You guys covered all the bases! Amazing. Diet, Detox, Dental. That is the next step on our journey, removing the old metal toxins from the teeth. It is a tricky procedure not to re-infect the body so we are now looking for the right person in Los Angeles/Orange County. We have a couple prospects we are following up on. Thanks.

paragraphs.name: f955
paragraphs.text: a11, thank you for responding. I hear you. You are fighting the good fight it sounds like. I think we differ in opinion on chemotherapy as my research has found it to be both cancer causing and immune system depleting. And yes, western medicine absolutely has its place and thank God. But because much of their training comes from the drug companies…

We have seen that MDs use conventional therapies for their own families or for their own cancers. this suggests to me that the conventional therapies are still the best bet. Steve Jobs might still be alive today had he opted for conventional therapies from the beginning.

paragraphs.text: Good question. I think there’s a big difference between processed sugar and what is found in fruits. My wife pretty much sticks to berries as they have the lowest glycemic content. She eats a little apple and avoids oranges. And then bread converts into sugar so that is taken in minimally as well. Processed sugar though is the thing we really avoid.
Thank you for sharing!
